snippet: The company blamed cooling growth in emerging markets and the negative impact of foreign exchange rates, which it expects to have even greater impact this year.
abstract: Coca-Cola reports that its net income fell 8.5 percent, to $1.71 billion, or 38 cents a share, in fourth quarter of 2013, compared with $1.87 billion, or 41 cents a share, in same period a year earlier; blames cooling growth in emerging markets and negative impact of foreign exchange rates, which it expects to have even greater impact this year.
lead_paragraph: The company blamed cooling growth in emerging markets and the negative impact of foreign exchange rates, which it expects to have even greater impact this year.

headline.main: Profit Slides 8.5% for Coke, as Weak Sales Abroad Hit Hard
headline.print_headline: Profit Slides 8.5% for Coke, as Weak Sales Abroad Hit Hard
